newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Oracle sees better Q3 Europe performance.
newsitem.headline: Oracle sees better Q3 Europe performance.

text.p: U.S. software company Oracle Corp expects its performance in Europe to improve in its third quarter ending February 1997, said Ray Lane, its president and chief operating officer on Tuesday.
"We have a new team, (a new) manager in Europe. I am confident we will have better numbers in Europe," Lane told Reuters in an interview.
"The European market is growing slower but we can grow it faster...I certainly expect better numbers in Q3," he said.
Goldman Sachs & Co analyst Rick Sherlund said on Monday that Oracle's stock price was unlikely to gain from recent lows until the company reported its third quarter results in March.

"It will likely take some encouraging news on European operations for the stock to perform and investor apprehensions may grow as the quarter progresses," said Sherlund in a report released on Monday in the United States.
Lane said sales in Europe were weak due to management problems.
Oracle said during the reporting of its second quarter results that sales in Europe grew 16 percent, compared to 49 percent in the U.S. and Latin Amercia.
Oracle's second-quarter revenues rose 36 percent to US$1.31 billion from $967.2 million a year ago.
